required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: eCHANGE: eHealth Design to Facilitate Weight Maintenance Following Initial Weight Loss
clinical_study.official_title: eCHANGE: Using eHealth Design to Facilitate Weight Maintenance Following Initial Weight Loss

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate an eHealth intervention facilitating weight maintenance following initial weight loss during a 3-month trial (pilot test)

detailed_description.textblock: Obesity rates are rapidly increasing and even with diets and interventions aiding weight loss, an alarmingly large percentage of people struggle to maintain the lost weight. In the face of obesity, weight maintenance is therefore arising as a major obstacle and new innovative approaches are called for. Despite the fact that a substantial number of web-based diets, health and fitness focused interventions or "apps" already exist, few focus on weight maintenance, are research based or available post study. In addition, most have yet to show short- or long-term effect and few, if any, are developed together with users (e.g., patients, health care professionals). eHealth solutions may therefore be a "missing link" in supporting self-regulation and motivation for sustainable health behavior change and weight loss maintenance. The aim of this study is to evaluate a person-centered, evidence based interactive eHealth intervention facilitating weight maintenance following initial weight loss during a 3- month feasibility pilot trial.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Testing a prototype of an eHealt self-management intervention of long-term weight loss maintenance to evaluate usability and preliminary efficacy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 3 months post baseline
primary_outcome.description: Collected data from system use log and from study specific system usefulness questions (use and perceived usefulness)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 3 months post baseline

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 3 months post baseline
other_outcome.description: 21 item scale to evaluate cognitive restraint, emotional eating and bingeing behaviors

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 3 months post baseline
other_outcome.description: A self-reporting questionnaire of 19 individual items, creating 7 components that produce one global score.

1o item scale measuring usability, with five response options for respondents; from Strongly agree to Strongly disagree. The obtainable score range is 25 to 100. A SUS score above a 68 would be considered above average and anything below 68 is below average.

other_outcome.measure: TWente Engagement with Ehealth Technologies Scale (TWEETS)
other_outcome.description: To measure behavioral, cognitive and affective engagment with a 5 point Likert scale: strongly disagree, disagree, neutral, agree, strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: The Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) - Assessing change
other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 3 months post baseline
other_outcome.description: 14 item scale measuring anxiety and depression. Respondents are asked to indicate which of 4 response options (rated from 0-3; score range, 0-42) comes closest to describing how they have been feeling in the previous week for each item. Scores from 0-7 on the subscales are regarded as being in the normal range; a score of 11 or higher indicates a probable presence of a mood disorder, and a score of 8-10 is suggestive of the presence of the state.

other_outcome.measure: RAND Health Related Quality of Life
other_outcome.time_frame: 36 item scale measuring health related quality of life. The RAND-36 consists of eight scaled scores, which are the weighted sums of the questions in their section. Each scale is directly transformed into a 0-100 scale on the assumption that each question
other_outcome.description: At baseline and at 3 months post baseline

other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 3 months post baseline
other_outcome.description: Patient reported outcome measures that assesses the symptoms that are commonly associated with obesity, next to quality of life, general functional status and well-being.

other_outcome.measure: Treatment Self-Regulation Questionnaire (TSRQ diet and exercise)
other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 3 months post baseline
other_outcome.description: A theoretically derived scale which assesses the degree of autonomous self-regulation regarding why people engage or would engage in healthy behavior

other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 3 months post baseline
other_outcome.description: A 4-item questionnaire, that assesses participants' feelings of competence about engaging in a healthier behavior (e.g., diet) and participating in a physical activity regularly.

arm_group.description: Pre-post evaluation of a 3-month pilot-trial of an electronic health (eHealth) intervention

intervention.description: eCHANGE is an eHealth intervention aiming to support long-term weight maintenance after initial weight loss

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 30 or more before weight loss
- 8% weight reduction or more through conservative methods
- Aim to maintain weight after weight loss or prevent weight gain
- Understand and read the Norwegian languague
- Can access the internet and own a smartphone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Weight loss through surgery or medication
- Medication to support weight loss or maintenance
